Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-chips] <rainbro7> How are you guys going to set yourself apart from other crypto casinos? Like edgeless. I guess they are not fully decentralized... But they have low fees which people like. It would be cool if you guys reduced fees and added a tip the dealer option. Poker pros normally tip the dealer, I wonder if they would tip the ecosystem üòÇ

Author: Gateway#3763
Content:
[dscrd-chips] <NutellaLicka> The current plan for rake is 1% which is significantly lower than every online poker facilitator. 0.5% to development, 0.25% to dealers and 0.25% to BVVs. This is subject to adjustment once we have considered all of the factors at play.
I dont mind the tip the dealer option though. That sounds like a reasonable thing to add. 
The biggest draw card for CHIPS is the decentralised, trust less nature of the dapp.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-chips] <allbits> Can dealer portion of rake be a parameter set by dealer?

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-chips] <NutellaLicka> I'd suggest not. I think it doesnt require a variable parameter. The idea is to give people an incentive to setup a dealer node, not to create a set of tables with different rake amounts.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-chips] <rainbro7> Im sure the dealer nodes will get great tips. I know poker players, sometimes they only win 100 and tip $5, pretty nice! I wouldn't üòÇ

Author: Gateway#3763
Content:
[dscrd-chips] <NutellaLicka> If you look at the pic below, the average rake of different facilitators is around 4-5%. 
I'd suggest that even having a 2% rake would be a massive improvement for players and provide some decent dev funds

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-chips] <NutellaLicka> http://www.firsttimepokerplayer.com/Images/micro-stakes-rake.png

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-chips] <rainbro7> But im overcomplicating things üòÇ

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-chips] <rainbro7> Im just excited, crypto conditions will be great for chips and I think people will be really interested in playing :)

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-chips] <rainbro7> It would also be cool to see chatting enabled or maybe select an emoticon face while betting. Part of the fun of poker is trying to read the others.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-chips] <joe2x4> @NutellaLicka what is the average rake size vs popularity? Does a lower rake actually equal more popular?

Author: Gateway#3763
Content:
[dscrd-chips] <NutellaLicka> That is a hard one to measure. Rake size is actually hard to work out, and a lot of them have rake back incentives if you play a lot with them. The article I pulled that from did the math over 1000 hands I believe.
I know poker players care a lot about rake. Especially professional ones. Be cause they have to put more hours in, to get the take that they have paid back. The more rake per pot they pay, the less money per hour they're getting

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-chips] <NutellaLicka> Also there are many other factors driving people to poker sites. Things I've noted are: Rake, deposit/withdrawal features and facilities, the actual players on the site and how they play(whether they're majority professionals or amateurs), whether the site offers different tournaments, whether it's mainly cash games, how many hands one can play at a time and how smoothly the application runs when opening multiple tables.
